Event.name: Drop_in_on
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives at the <fen>Host_location</fen> as a guest of the <fen>Host</fen>, for the purpose of achieving a <fen>Purpose</fen>. The <fen>Purpose</fen> is often social in nature, i.e., the visit itself constitutes a goal.
<ex><fex name="Visitor">I</fex>'m gonna <t>drop</t> <t>in</t> <fex name="Host">on Kieth</fex> <fex name="Time">for a while</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Visitor
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives at the Host_location to visit the <fen>Host</fen> for a <fen>Purpose</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Normal_location
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Normal_location</fen> is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While <fen>Normal_location</fen> expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent. If present, they often express a general direction from which a <fen>Visitor</fen> moves, rather than a landmark away from which it moves.</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Normal_location</fen> nor the <fen>Host</fen> or Host_location. In this frame, <fen>Path</fen> expressions almost always have a via-sense.</def-root>

Arg.name: Host
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Host</fen> is the person highly associated with the goal location of the <fen>Visitor</fen>, and who allows the <fen>Visitor</fen> onto his/her territory, and possibly to make use of available resources. The <fen>Host</fen> and <fen>Visitor</fen> and in a host-guest relationship.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Manner</fen> expression describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives.</def-root>

Arg.name: Mode_of_transportation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> expresses how the motion of the <fen>Visitor</fen> is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the <fen>Visitor</fen>. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when arriving occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives at a location associated with the <fen>Host</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Host_location
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Host_location</fen> is a place primarily associated with the <fen>Host</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Containing_event</fen> denotes an event or state of affairs that occurs or holds at a time that includes the time during which the visiting takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>The frequency with whic hthe <fen>Visitor</fen> drops in on a <fen>Host</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Visitor</fen> remains with the <fen>Host</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The larger area within which the visiting takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates that the visiting is a particular instance in a series of repeated visiting events.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that explains why the <fen>Visitor</fen> is making a visit.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: pop in.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make a short, unannounced visit.
